text: Heads up. Feedback is in
/giphy survey says
/giphy family feud
i hate you, giphy
/giphy everything’s gonna be alright
welp
<@U0260V4K1|justin> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/justin/F08NQCKM3/drinky_crow_by_helbetico-d398fj4.jpg|drinky_crow_by_helbetico-d398fj4.jpg>
okay - I have 4 things I’m thinking about this that I need a heat check on:

1) on free play games

so my main concern with this is that these games just aren’t fun to play until you add money.  I don’t think we’re going to convert people into Long Game this way, and honestly, I fear we could poison the well by showing people a boring game without the benefit of the savings.

Ultimately - the audience for this is an audience that wants to save money. The game play isn’t anything other than a way to win some bonus money, and if you’re in it solely for the winnings there are way way better places to do that. 

The most compelling offering LG has to offer is that moment when you’re playing AND saving money at the same time.

2) Playing in All States
Unless something has changed from our kickoff, the reality is that you can’t play from all states. Yes, we can offer cashless games in all states, but I have a hard time seeing someone being compelled to do that. Especially considering that LG holds your money for at least 2 years.

Worse is that not making this clear up front saves the incoming disappointment until the person has already gone through the signup process, which for my money makes LG feel a little skeezy. 

Even if we do end up offering a cashless playing account - I feel strongly that we should make that clear at the beginning of the relationship instead of once they’ve finished the signup process.

3) Reduced Copy
I’m willing to cede this one, but for my part I think it will result in fewer signups if we don’t explain to people why we’re asking for info like a mobile number (that would creep me out, but maybe I’m just lame) or explaining what we’re looking for in terms of banking info (i.e. that we want their bank website log in info, not their bank account info (which, yes, I fucked up the copy on that one))

4) Overall length of flow:
The flow Lindsay has here is 6 views, as opposed to our 8, which yes is less, but she also hasn’t included a space to add money your wallet. So assuming thats a required part of playing, her revisions save us 1 view.
personally I’d like to talk to her about this - but there does exist a reality in which either I’m crazy or we want to just do what she’s asking in the interest of moving things along

I don't think you're crazy. I assumed she wanted to eliminate the state barrier so that more people would sign up. I don't know what other reason there is. Not sure what else to say on the rest... except I agree with you on most of it.
I assume thats why she did it too - I just think it’s a huge mistake for a brand that is supposed to be managing peoples long-terms savings accounts to effectively trick people into signing up
Forgoing the "transparent" and "trustworthy" brand attributes we agreed on from the start.
It sounds like a battle between simplicity and transparency, seems safer to err on the side of more info, but I overexplain and overthink everything so maybe most people don't care about that.
I agree that that is the argument she’s attempting to explore, and it’s a worthwhile one, but from what I’m seeing, what she’s really done is just cut all the copy
which is fine but experience tells me people that wouldn’t read it will skip over it regardless, and people who want to know more will be put off by the lack of info
<out of context interjection> Can we hide informational copy behind (i) button or similar?
I was just thinking the same thing. We had talked briefly about a More Info button where we could hide the explainer text but still have it there if needed.
Yeah - I think we can totally do that
are we going to push out our design review, or do you guys want to get together?
your call!
I told phillip I realized that meeting we just had wasn't the design checkin meeting I thought it was going to be
I can show you guys what I have
yeah sure
Phillip and I are trying to share the Keynote file now so I can focus on app stuff
